item.title: Putin speaks his truth, yet again
item.description:
Tadeusz Giczan 🇺🇦 on Twitter

“Wow, Putin basically just stopped pretending: “During the war with Sweden, Peter the Great didn’t conquer anything, he took back what had always belonged to us, even though all of Europe recognised it as Sweden’s. It seems now it’s our turn to get our lands back [smiling]”.”

URL: https://twitter.com/TadeuszGiczan/status/1534910119519178752

item.title: which professions think mainly in the moment?
item.description:
Michael in Oxford, London, Bern soon on Twitter

“What professions spend much of their time thinking incredibly hard 0.1 to 10 sec ahead? To rephrase: which are most fully in-the-moment? + Musicians + Many professional sports people + In general, anything involving live performance, esp. improvisation”

item.title: Memo RBA: we ought to live with inflation, more of it
item.description:
That’s the headline for my latest piece in The Conversation. The article initially ran under a different headline, chosen by the publishers with an eye to maximising the number of search terms, but this failed miserably, and my preferred headline was restored. The insistence of publishers on choosing headlines has been a c…

URL: https://johnquigginblog.substack.com/p/memo-rba-we-ought-to-live-with-inflation?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: In the Generations After 1870, All That Is Solid Does Melt into Air, &

item.title: The Jews and Italians Against Liberalism
item.description:
An ill wind blew through the land. Life, suddenly crackling, was not what it once was. The young, they said, did not respect the old, and the nation they knew now did not resemble the nation of their memories, when chaos did not seem to swallow up so much. Crime was up, gas prices were up, and the rage they felt was no longer confined…

URL: https://rossbarkan.substack.com/p/the-jews-and-italians-against-liberalism?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: In the Generations After 1870, All That Is Solid Does Melt into Air, &

item.title: Does not compute
item.description:
There are days when I think that the history of our era, whenever it is written, will say that we were a society with manageable problems until the internet came along and ruined everything. I’m not completely convinced of this; not yet. But there are days when I think it, and more of them all the time…

URL: https://ryanavent.substack.com/p/does-not-compute?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: In the Generations After 1870, All That Is Solid Does Melt into Air, &

item.title: Gorm
item.description:
Gorm on Twitter

“After years of floundering, I think I’m finally getting it: You get energy by spending it. The fuel tank metaphor is completely misleading. The body supplies energy to meet demand. The tank *expands* if you use a lot of fuel. In other words, biology is fundamentally antifragile”

URL: https://twitter.com/metaphorician/status/1529402899016699906

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 30, 2022

item.description:

URL: https://twitter.com/ntaylor963/status/1528031576486912000

Brad Hill on Twitter

item.title: Ken Kocienda
item.description:
Ken Kocienda on Twitter

“I see so many tweets about agile, epics, scrums, story points, etc. and none of it matters. We didn’t use any of that to ship the best products years ago at Apple.”

URL: https://twitter.com/kocienda/status/1526564983328342016

item.title: Ken Kocienda
item.description:
Ken Kocienda on Twitter

“Do you know what worked? A clear vision. Design-led development. Weekly demos to deciders who always made the call on what to do next. Clear communication between cross functional teams. Honest feedback. Managing risk as a function of the rate of actual progress toward goals.”

URL: https://twitter.com/kocienda/status/1526564985995857921

source: Best of Twitter - Week of May 30, 2022
